title: Unilateral Conductive Hearing Loss Post-Mastoidectomy
chief_complaint: I am here for a follow-up to monitor my hearing sensitivity. I have a long history of ear issues on my left side.

problem_summary.functional_impact: Patient currently wears a hearing aid in the left ear.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Monitor hearing sensitivity and ensure stability.

history.present_illness: Patient presents for routine monitoring of long-standing unilateral conductive hearing loss.
history.otologic_history: History of cholesteatoma with multiple surgeries on the left ear starting at age 2. Last surgery was a mastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction in 2004 (approx. 11 years ago).
history.prior_management: Wears a hearing aid in the left ear.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear shows normal hearing sensitivity (0-10 dB HL). Left ear shows a slight sloping to mild conductive hearing loss (250-6000 Hz), sloping to moderate at 8000 Hz. Bone conduction is normal in the left ear, indicating a conductive pathology.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: SRT is consistent with PTA bilaterally. Word recognition scores are excellent (100%) in both ears at suprathreshold levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Immittance testing was not measured at this appointment.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with normal hearing sensitivity in the right ear and a slight-to-mild sloping to moderate conductive hearing loss in the left ear. Word recognition is excellent bilaterally. The conductive nature of the left-sided loss is consistent with the history of mastoidectomy and ossicular chain reconstruction.
counseling_points: Your hearing test today confirms that your inner ear (nerve) hearing remains normal on both sides.
The hearing loss in your left ear is 'conductive,' meaning sound is not getting through the middle ear system efficiently due to your prior surgeries, which is expected.
Since your word recognition scores are excellent, you are a great candidate to continue using your hearing aid.
Please continue to use hearing protection in noisy environments to protect your inner ear hearing.
We will see you back annually to monitor your hearing sensitivity.
notes_for_actor: You are a 26-year-old female accustomed to your hearing loss.
You have had this condition since age 2, so you are knowledgeable about your history (surgeries, mastoidectomy).
You are compliant with hearing aid use and have no new complaints (no dizziness, no tinnitus).
Your demeanor is calm and routine; this is a standard check-up for you.
